ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: A better understanding of design elements and greater exposure to art.

SO MUCH. as someone who was already artistic, this course gave me the language i needed to describe and examine the elements of graphic design. learned about visual rhythm, balance, distribution, positive/negative space, some color, typography, and more. i was skeptical at first, because the class starts off with you cutting and gluing lines of paper. but henk did a wonderful job of guiding us and by the end i was creating more complex projects that i needed those foundational skills for.

Henk taught a very strong sense of design principles and creative processes. The class was much less focused on simple graphic designs, and instead focused on teaching strategic and creative approaches to good design.

An amazing introduction on how to think like a designer. While the workload was pretty heavy, it was a nice break from the standard Pset or readings. It was nice to exercise a different part of my brain!
The underlying principals behind modern-day graphic design, but not using computer technology like Photoshop, etc.

Ive never taken a graphic design course before, so this was my first introduction to the actual methods behind graphic design. Ive found the courses subject material to be extremely useful in my own endeavors in graphic design, whether for personal use or to further my career.

Great introduction to graphic design - emphasis on individual projects, which make up the course work, but Henk also does an amazing job of giving us historical examples and presentations that showed us a great portion of the graphic design world. Super interesting class! developed skills for  how to critic others work and language to talk about design.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Enjoyed all the workshops

strengths: henk is great at constructive criticism and the class assignments were always fun for me

weaknesses: the cost. the fee for art classes should cover our materials. i had to pay more out of pocket.

The strength of this class is Henk and his commitment to strong design principles and strategy. Henk operates with--and brings out in his students--professional behavior immediately. Weakness is that in class time can get a bit boring--spending 2+ hours talking about everyones work or their half-fleshed out ideas. Maybe more variety could improve the class structure?
The course is an excellent introduction to the principals of graphic design and the assignments are sequentially arranged so that your skills as a designer grow over the semester.

The strength of the course comes from the way Henk has it set up. Every project taught me something different about graphic design. If there was any weakness to the course, it would just come from the fact that there isnt enough time to learn more.

Henk is an amazing professor, he is incredibly kind and structured critiques in a way that make them super helpful and low stakes - they are not intimidating and the class environment is super fun. He has great insight for how to improve work and extend create your ideas. He also gives lots of time to develop and work on projects - while projects are a lot of work, they are stretched out over a few weeks, with much smaller deadlines in between.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: Yes. It was a lovely course. I learned a lot and enjoyed the learning atmosphere Henk created.
YES!
I would recommend this course only to people that having the time required for a strong commitment to the course. Poor commitment will be obvious.
Yes! It is a very fun class with some great lessons on thinking like a designer.

Yes! This class is not a walk in the park - there are homework assignments due in almost every class - but if you want to learn about things like visual rhythm, balanced compositions, and communicating a message using visual forms, this is the class for you. It is NOT a photoshop class, which some students did not like. In my opinion, having to make collages and draw by hand allowed me to better understand graphic design, but know what you are walking into.
I would absolutely recommend this course to other students. You learn graphic design in a way that wouldnt be possible without the course and the professor.
Yes!! This class is so fun and a very enjoyable way to take an introductory art/design course. Henk makes it totally worth it!
